text: The Gulf South Conference Men's Basketball Tournament is the annual conference basketball championship tournament for the Gulf South Conference. The tournament has been held annually since 1981. It is a single-elimination tournament and seeding is based on regular season records. The winner, declared conference champion, receives the Gulf South's automatic bid to the NCAA Men's Division II Basketball Championship. ==Results== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !Champions !Score !Runner-Up !MVP !Venue |- align=center | 1981 |North Alabama |81–70 |Jacksonville State |Johnny Buckmon, North Alabama |Flowers Hall (Florence, AL) |- align=center | 1982 |Livingston |49–47 |Tennessee–Martin |Will Cotchery, Livingston |Pruitt Hall (Livingston, AL) |- align=center | 1983 |Jacksonville State |79–74 |Valdosta State |Robert Spurgeon, Jacksonville St. |Pete Mathews Coliseum (Jacksonville, AL) |- align=center | 1984 |North Alabama |82–78 |Jacksonville State |Melvin Allen, Jacksonville St. |Flowers Hall (Florence, AL) |- align=center | 1985 |Jacksonville State |86–73 |Delta State |Keith McKeller, Jacksonville St. |Pete Mathews Coliseum (Jacksonville, AL) |- align=center | 1986 |Delta State |83–66 |Jacksonville State |Carl Brown, Delta St. |Walter Sillers Coliseum (Cleveland, MS) |- align=center | 1987 |West Georgia |83–75 |Delta State |Rodney Roberts, West Georgia |UWG Coliseum (Carrollton, GA) |- align=center | 1988 |North Alabama |79–75 |Troy State |Louis Newsome, North Alabama |Sartain Hall (Troy, AL) |- align=center | 1989 |Jacksonville State |85–74 |Livingston |Robert Lee Sanders, Jacksonville St. |Pete Mathews Coliseum (Jacksonville, AL) |- align=center | 1990 |colspan="5"|Not held |- align=center | 1991 |colspan="5"|Not held |- align=center | 1992 |Jacksonville State |90–77 |Mississippi College |Dave Edmond, Jacksonville St. |Pete Mathews Coliseum (Jacksonville, AL) |- align=center | 1993 |Delta State |72–66 |Jacksonville State |Todd Mundt, Delta St. |Walter Sillers Coliseum (Cleveland, MS) |- align=center | 1994 |North Alabama |66–62OT |Livingston |Curtis Davis, North Alabama |A.
